info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:44PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wayne, Jefferson and northwestern Hamilton Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 344 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ashley, or 11 miles west of Mount Vernon, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Woodlawn around 350 PM CDT. Mount Vernon around 400 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bluford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 86 and 101. Interstate 64 in Illinois between Mile Markers 63 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central Illinois.
